poExrajS17ERwKfw4qmf_w.text: This place is A MESS. Thats the best way to put it. Came here around 4am after visiting XS nightclub.   1. When ordering the food I had to shout and could barely hear the questions the attendant was asking me because the music was just so damn loud. I understand thats what this place is about so I tried to overlook it but the noise became a problem again.  2. The pickup food area is a MESS. Not a single soul was able to hear their number being called so the counter area where you pickup food is CROWDED. I wanted to avoid this so I looked on their TV screens to see when my order was ready. My order showed as ready. so I went to the counter to pickup my order and this is when the REAL mess started   3. 1st, employees were just shouting out names and placing the orders on the counter without verifying the receipts and just went straight back to making the next orders and trying to avoid customer interaction AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. I get it, youre busy but they created a bigger mess because now people were just taking what they thought was their order. As a result when I FINALLY showed the employee my receipt he said he had to remake it since someone else took it.   4. This employee then disappeared into the back and I stood there assuming my food was being remade. Waited around 20 mins just standing there and he straight up just disappeared. Meanwhile, my name is no longer showing on the screen because it must seem like my order was already taken care of. I ask another employee what the status of my order is only to have her roll her eyes at me and tell me they're just really busy and they'll work on it.   5. I wait another 10-15 mins. At this point there are SEVERAL people with order issues, or couldn't hear their order numbers and someone else took their orders etc so now theres about 8 of us just crowded in front of the counter. At this point, given common sense the manager or someone should have instructed the staff to take care of those remake orders FIRST before moving on to new orders. This did not happen. They just kept moving on to new orders therefore only intensifying the problem, making the area more crowded and overwhelming everyone in that area. Multiple bags of food just left on the counter with no owner because no one could hear a damn thing from the music blasting. At this point around 2-3 people got so fed up and went to the cashier to cancel/ask for refunds.   6. I waited another 5 mins holding in my frustration because I get it, theyre slammed but also theyre just making a bigger mess. They FINALLY call my name only to realize its a order for a different Kevin. I  told them I ordered ALOT more than this and I asked which order number this was for and the employee responded with "we dont go by order numbers here, each employee takes care of their own orders so we go by name" and I was just shocked.... like you dont go by order numbers? Why do you give order numbers out then? I was so confused because some of the bags had names + order numbers written on them and some just had names. So Im assuming its employee preference and not really standard operating procedure?   7. I FINALLY flagged someone down after ALL customers were ignored as much as possible. I asked her kindly, if she could please look into the status of my order. She took my receipt and said Ill make it now. she ended up making my order based off the receipt. At this point I was just ready to get out of there so I was relieved. She made my order, just tossed it to me with no "here you go" or "sorry about the mixup/wait" just straight up tossed the bag on the counter and tossed my receipt with it and turned right back around. I didnt even check to see if everything on my order was correct because honestly this place was a mess and after being there for almost 1 hour, I was ready to go back and sleep. mind you this was almost 5am at this point.   Overall, this was my 3/4th visit to Taco Bell Cantina but first time ordering to go at 4am. I will never go to this place again for late night eats in Vegas because its just WAYY to unorganized. Not to mention, the food prep/kitchen area was a MESS. Cheese in the lettuce containers, employees not changing out their gloves after touching surfaces that was probably not food prep friendly. The floor was littered with taco wrapper paper and ingredients etc.   Also, when it comes to customer service, this place could definitely use some retraining. The employees were giving attitude to customers who simply wanted to know the status of their order. For instance a guy asked should I go ask for a refund? or is my order being worked on? The female employee responded "you can do whatever you want and it might be better for you to get a refund because we cant make your order right this second" From her extremely agitated tone, I was shocked to say the least that that is what Taco Bell trains their employees to respond with.

Si-l8dfYdzF2j1CAjIKbAw.text: I wanted to give this place 5 stars so badly but it was a disappointment and the staff was very unpleasant. To be clear I love Taco Bell and was looking forward to a drink and some Crunchwrap supreme action!! While my food was just as good as I have come to expect from any Taco Bell I thought the cantina experience didn't offer much more than that! So for a fast food stop with the added bonus of a standard frozen drink, sure - but if you want it to be as fun as the website promotes you may be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u2_6bhN686ehZGWCWM3-IQ.text: I either have had a foodie nightmare or I have found myself in fast food heaven.   On a recommendation from my 20 something year old son and daughter we visited Taco Bell Cantina last night. This is a Taco Bell on the main strip of Las Vegas. The difference??  Two levels of seating, secret menu with multiple items, a soft drink menu that included slushees with alcohol, multiple tv monitors that displayed all sports events, and a disc jockey playing modern hip hop music at incredibly high volume levels.   My family elected a dinner of nachos bell grandes, tacos, burritos, enchiritos, taco fries, and chalupas. We had slushees with jack daniels and ate listening to artists like Pit Bull, Sean Paul, T Pain and Migos. Not that I know ANY of these people but my kids seemed to be fully aware of their songs.   Overall it was a fun and unique experience, one catered to the younger crowd but I still enjoyed it. Not a lot of expectations for the food other than your standard fast food flavors and selection.

n7O6HQXVjjfnGwofwP0e4A.text: Came here for the hype, and yeah this place looks cool but honestly it's A-ok, just like the three star rating says. I ordered a Pina Colada slushie which was actually pretty good, just a little lacking in water since it was pretty thick but thats all slushies at TB. Fam and I ordered a bunch of food to eat there and the presentation and all is cool it's just that our food came unwrapped, which was a major bummer since this way it doesn't keep warm. Other than that, service was good and this place is a great hangover cure, or cause for hangover, whichever you prefer.

zqapVh3nsQXUGXt-jGKJZg.text: BOMB.COM and this is coming from a girl who doesn't even eat Taco Bell nor the fact that I haven't eaten Taco Bell in well over a decade but this was a bucket list for me while in Vegas! And it was downstairs from my hotel! (Planet Hollywood).  Came around 1AM because duh, THERE WAS A LIVE DJ PEOPLE!! DJ! And slushy drinks!! On the menu, lol, there's a small service for a wedding starting at $600 lmao.  Long story short, staff were great, nacho fries were the best, chicken nuggets were awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yIcPMdMkx7HR3z3WTLfYmg.text: Taco bell is what I get when I want junk food.  This strip location is like a taco bell on steroids. It's got two floors, a DJ, alcoholic slushies, an open kitchen, and some exclusive menu items. The food items are the same prices as any taco bell. I got the jalapeno dippers, a quesarito, and a "twisted" baja blast with rum. The frozen drinks flavors were blue raspberry, pina colada, "frose", cherry, margarita, Pepsi, and baja blast. You could get them with rum, tequila, whiskey, or vodka. They had basic and top shelf at different prices. The yard comes with 2 shots of basic alcohol for 15 dollars. You can add a shot for 5 dollars. They dont do refills (but lifehack: the sugar factory right next door in the miracle miles does 10 dollar refills on the yards with their own drinks). They do have a normal bar on the second floor too. They had a lot of TV screens playing sports and movies.  My food and drink came out within 5 minutes. They forgot about my friends order though and she had to wait like 15 minutes for some cinnamon bites and her pina colada. They gave her extra as an apology but still. Overall it was an interesting experience. This location is like a taco bell crossed with a club and a sports bar. I wouldn't go out of my way to come to this particular location again though.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DKIHNLpBtCYfjZ-gg0ix2g.text: On the strip, a Taco Bell with cool music and a bar!  It could easily be brought up a star but for the poor, frenetic service at the main counter. They have many of your Taco Bell favorites, with the addition of smoothies, either virgin or with alcohol. Pay for an extra shot, and they happily give you "half" a shot, as evidenced by a three count poor, so stick with the normal one, or skip altogether. My son, who is 19, was asked if he wanted his with booze or without. No carding? They were busy and quite flustered at the time, but really could use some real management help.  Upstairs there is more seating, and a full regular bar that you would never know is there unless you went up. Taco Bell is a good place for a quick bite that you may be comfortable with, all while saving some dough compared to every other place on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OIpC-fgstsE0_IxFiLJv-g.text: This is my favorite Taco Bell I have ever been to!   My first visit was a late night feast with my bachelorette party last year. Granted we were not the typical bachelorette party. It was my 2 bffs and all of our moms. It was pretty packed, but one of the moms was able to secure a table in the outside patio area while the rest of us placed our food orders. Maybe it was the booze talking, but everything was hot and tasted fresh! They had a live DJ upstairs and the music was keeping everyone hype.   A couple weeks ago I found myself in Vegas again and knew I wanted to come back here. I came out of the Magic Mike show at the Hard Rock feeling good and grabbed a Lyft over to Taco Bell. It wasn't as crowded as last time but they still had their late night DJ blasting music. I also noticed the merch rack that used to be in the middle of the store is gone, and that there were just a few items left displayed on the wall. But I wasn't there for clothes, I needed FOOD. I ordered nacho fries supreme, a quesadilla, a taco and a boozy slushie. Everything was just perfection again! Food came out quickly and for as busy as the place can get, the restaurant was clean and well managed with friendly employees.  On my last day in Vegas I wanted to stop by one last time. It was right after a heavy lunch, but I still grabbed a boozy tequila slushie for $10.  Ohh, Taco Bell Cantina, you remain one of my favorite spots in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mini feast for 1

Gq8svV8xkWQ9W50Y7_pXcg.text: Absolutely the worst!  The music was so loud that it made it impossible to order cuz they can't hear you and you can't hear them. you can't even stand outside without the music blaring!

keuA8sOTX1m8mkdyWZVocQ.text: So, it's pretty cool that there's a Taco Bell on the strip but that's about it. Upon entering, you can either order at the kiosk or at the registers. The lines were unorganized and the DJ on the second floor was so loud that I could barely hear myself think. I ended up ordering a drink through the kiosk and once it was placed, my name went up on a screen that showed they were working on it.   I waited until I saw that it was ready but I didn't know that there is a separate pick up area for food and drinks. I had bought a drink with alcohol in it and apparently, you have to pick it up at the front where the registers are. There is no pickup area so I ended up standing in line where they still had to make it. If you add a shot to your drink, you'll be waiting a little longer because of the process.  Overall, if you want food, by all means, come here. If you want a drink, consider Fat Tuesday.

bubyR_WGPO7mIQsK-PYM7Q.text: This will be the most lit Taco Bell you'll ever experience. It's at the heart of the strip and perfect for friends to get together and continue the wild night with BOMB Nacho Fries Supreme.   You got a poppin dj that is sometimes even better than the club, you got a camera showcasing shenanigans from the deck above, and you got alcoholic Baja Blasts. What more can you ask for?   I stayed in Vegas for 2 nights, and we went there both nights. Push away authenticity and go for the fun!

MayHqnqP3S4PPxpmH6nrSg.text: Don't believe the hype! Their "alcoholic slushies" are a joke. I got the yard cherry slushie with rum. And I can't taste a single bit alcohol. My friend got a small Baja blast with Bacardi and you can barely BARELY taste the alcoholic.   I tried to see if I can get my money back. But they don't do refunds for drinks. The cashier told me there is 2 shots in the yard.  !?!?! Are you serious?! Just 2 shots?!! WHERE'S THE RUM THOUGH?!  Taco Bell Cantina, you're such a disappointment. I'll just stick with my Fat Tuesday. They never fail me!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where it belongs.

pN73XmnJwudwLm6gZG-Wwg.text: A bit disappointed. Thought this would be a cool place with lots of seating and a lounge vibe.  Arrived and realized it was tiny and overhyped - it's just a glorified Taco Bell done up Vegas style that serves alcoholic mixed drinks.  Bf and I walked in, looked around, said to each other "that's it?!", then left to go eat/hang out somewhere else.  The place is decorated in lounge style, dim with colored lights, music booming loudly. Have to admit it looked kind of cool.  Size wise, it's tinyyyy. Literally like, a little corner shop tucked away on strip. We walked by and missed it the first time. It gets crowded lining up waiting to order, merchandise stands take up space. Cramped seating both inside and outside.  Nothing really special here, save your time in Vegas and go somewhere more unique and fun!   Bf and I love Taco Bell, but we weren't too impressed. Won't be back!

bg-Mfdw0HKNZ1srp8PV3ng.text: IT'S A TACO BELL WITH ALCOHOL AND HIP HOP! What is not to like?  This place was a lifesaver in Vegas as it allowed us to save so much on food when we were running over budget at the end of our trip. Heineken was under $6. A cravings deal was $5.99. We could get a complete and delicious meal, er, maybe not complete, but completely delicious, for about $15-$20 per person, including a beer.   They were blasting hip hop on the top floor where we sat on one visit. They also had some tvs showing various sporting competitions. On our next visit, we sat on the little outdoor patio. The seating here was a little cramped, but it made for great people watching of folks walking the Strip.  You can also get married here for very little $. The wedding in package includes a bunch of tacos and a hot sauce garter belt!   Staff was friendly on all our visits and I was very pleased when a chick agreed to serve me a beer even though I didn't have my license- had left it in a different bag at the hotel. I am so obviously over 21- I even showed her my grey hairs- so this was much appreciated!   They take cards. It was happy. Definitely one of the highlights of my trip!  Go here, eat tacos, drink beer!  Oh, they fill the beer from the bottom of the glass and then plug it with magnet. Don't remove the magnet or you will lose your beer! The magnet does make a great souvenir to bring home and throw on your fridge to remind you of the awesome time you had at this Taco Bell Cantina.

NG-UielKjjksm3VYxKU6wA.text: I am a huge fan of Taco Bell in general! Their food is always so delicious and innovative as well as incredibly affordable! I got their new chicken nachos. Though I was admittedly hesitant, I actually thoroughly enjoyed them, especially with their yummy nacho cheese dip. I always add in hot sauce to their cheese to add a bit of spice. I got their $5 cravings deal which is honestly such a steal, including a burrito, gordita, taco, nachos, and a drink! I also got a pepsi slushie (not with alcohol) which was amazing, especially amidst the Vegas heat. Everything was so good!  But what really makes this Taco Bell is the environment. With the DJ upstairs, the fun decor, the shining lights, the aura was amazing. It is definitely a place where you can jam to and just have a ton of fun without having to be 21 or having to be drunk. This is the place to go in Vegas in my opinion. Also the DJ that was there when I went was absolutely killing the game.

UTW-WQr_Q3GYa86ii4Qg6A.text: Taco Bell Cantina is ALWAYS open and the perfect hangover cure for a crazy night in Vegas.  You'll find the same menu as any other Taco Bell, but they serve alcohol and blast dance music throughout.  They also sell kitchy apparel like taco hats.  The interior was clubby but still clean.  The staff are really friendly and obviously know how to deal with drunk people.

i5Kwz-4rh7np9EWS1ievDg.text: Bottom Line: This is the most "lit" Taco Bell ever... literally. Don't come here in the daytime, come here at night- it's like a popping club. Skip the boozy drinks here, compared to other places on the strip they are SLACKING.  Food: It's Taco Bell- take it or leave it! Lol! It's your typical Taco Bell meal...  Service: They have a dope board that displays your name and when your good is ready- can you say helpful when you're boozed up?   Atmosphere: AT NIGHT - if they had a dance floor I'm pretty sure I would have been twerking. Correction- I am sure that I would have been twerking. The music is LIVE and the cool retro lights make it even more fun!  Not a fan of: The "dining" area is small so there isn't a lot of seating.

gfo4J9f9b-STrB27soqJAA.text: The music is super loud in here, so get ready to shout your order to the cashier because you or them literally can't hear anyone if they're talking at a regular volume. This made it hard for us to ask questions about the drinks so we just ended up getting the same one that we got last time - mountain dew baja blast. It was a bit watery this time compared to last time but it tasted pretty much the same. The workers aren't that enthusiastic but I can tell that they're trying - everything is super loud all the time and it's super crowded at peak hours and half the people are drunk. We got our food within 15-20 minutes so it wasn't too bad considering they were pretty packed. The food tastes like any other taco bell, it's nothing special unless you get an alcoholic drink.

75hc5TnKXRQ4cjYipIGM9w.text: Super fun twist on Taco Bell! It's huge and they have alcoholic slushies which were amazing

Qqbpq7B6a9dRLBqJSfbfHg.text: You can't come to Vegas without coming here. I mean, it's Taco Bell C A N T I N A. It was surprisingly small, which I didn't expect. There's two levels and they're both poppin. The Baja blast was great and the DJ was unexpected but awesome. I didn't stay long but from what I saw, it was cool.

l5icMJKL_B2ETPpkKs3-Mg.text: ***Alcoholic Baja Blasts and Cheesy Gordita Crunches****  If that doesn't get your attention, I don't know what will.   This Taco Bell lives in the heart of The Strip right by Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Shops. I visited during the summer so this was a perfect place to stop by and get some AC and refreshments.    The service was quick. They have a screen that displays all the orders and the order they are completing them in. A must-try are their frozen alcoholic drinks, they range from margaritas to pina coladas to Baja Blasts, and you can pick the type of alcohol you want. I got a Baja Blast with tequila. It's seriously a dream.   I recommend sitting either outside by the misters or upstairs by the DJ ;) I swear, this guy is mixing music at all times of the day like it's a nightclub. I've never seen a Taco Bell this bangin'.    Bathrooms are upstairs too. The restaurant is smaller than it looks like in the pictures but it gets the job done. Two thumbs up from me! Prices are reasonable too.

yNwMW7MxpwlSo0RD2nQtBQ.text: I am a Taco Bell lover through and through. Every time I'm in Vegas, I make sure to come here. Fun atmosphere and perfect location on the Las Vegas strip.

wYZDGgDxGwvS67_bzAPh8A.text: Great food, but way too loud music and not good cleaning. It's obviously very busy as it's on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top flor with Strip view

pYwfPupcTyjRUAR2ytkPMQ.text: I'm glad I got to experience the hoopla of a Taco Bell Cantina.  It's a great concept with some additional food items you can't get at a regular Taco Bell and alcoholic frozen beverages.  This location looks a lot bigger in the pictures than it is, but there's plenty of room for the customers coming in and out of this place.  The store sells Taco Bell merchandise as well and offers a pretty loud/clubby vibe as music is pumped through the location.  If you haven't been to a Cantina location, this one's a good one to visit to get the overall idea of the concept.

kPElLbxTHyFtKtE-SxWnSA.text: Forever the freshest food, nice staff, great customer service.  A must see stop if you're in from out of town.

QRvuaGZLVPjfoG9nisrPBg.text: Taco Bell Cantina is a Taco Bell lovers dream come True.  If you don't like Taco Bell, this isn't going to change your mind.  If you do, this place is amazing.    You walk in, greeted by a wall of Freeze.  Plenty of different flavors, alcohol mixed in if you would like as well.  You can buy Taco Bell merchandise, shirts, swimsuits, and other items for the True Taco Bell fan.  Music is pumping fairly loudly the entire time due to the DJ upstairs.  While that makes it a little hard to hear, it's unique and fun.  The menu is the same as it is everywhere, as far as I could tell.  Prices are too.  I went with a $5 BIG BOX.  That included a normal taco, Cheesy Gordita Crunch, Burrito Supreme, nachos, and a drink.  I had them sub the drink for a Baja Blast Freeze.  Now that I think about it, I'm not sure what that did to the overall price, but it wasn't much.  Then you get to wait for your food, listening to the music and browsing the merchandise.  You can also look through the window to the kitchen and watch people make your food five feet and a glass panel away from you.  This was actually pretty interesting and fun to see.  You can see your name on the order screen and watch it make its way up the the line until they start making it.    The food was Taco Bell.  We ate upstairs and enjoyed the people watching from on high.  It was also around 1 AM.  These guys are open 24 hours a day, which is perfect for a late night meal after being out late.  I will definitely come back and don't care if the people with me don't want Taco Bell.

ZT6Cr4YXxKVIY3qXgoHZUg.text: I really enjoyed this Taco Bell, and the atmosphere was great. My only complaint is how overpriced the freezes were. This Taco Bell is known for its wall of several different flavors of frozen beverages. It was $10 for one of these freezes with one shot in it and $5 to add a shot. It would be awesome if they added a second shot for that $10. Drunk people LOVE Taco Bell, so the establishment would make up for it with more food sales. Still, it was the best quality Taco Bell food I've ever had.

l-GzVe0lMkb9UWlfBOg8lA.text: Do NOT come here. The nonalcoholic drinks suck. The employees are rude. And it's packed with people who stand in land for 20 mins and still don't know their order...  You might as well save your time and go to a normal Taco Bell.

e9nl4rxsTclfLh7mwH0xiw.text: Aside from going here at 2 am when the service is slow and the service could be friendlier, this place rocks! If you are a Taco Bell Fan you'll be thrilled to discover mixed drinks to have with your taco! There is limited seating outside but that is it. Or what i also thought was great was the merch they sold inside. Who doesn't want to purchase a Taco Bell sweatshirt or towel?!

FKV6ZSUHYOEPPfi5IHc6yw.text: First off I LOVE Taco Bell like have it almost every day love it. So thanks to the internet/buzzfeed/Taco Bell's own snapchat I was pretty excited to go.  Result?  Underwhelming   It was just like any other Taco Bell menu wise except 3 items they only sell. Yes there's alcoholic drinks but I made mine better by adding a good amount with the mini bottles I had.  The merch online seemed like a store and it's just a small shelving unit once you walk in.  Employees were nice in answering my questions but we did lunch before the rush came so they weren't swamped yet.  As for music it's um..."interesting" to say the least. As in hop you like bad hip hop.   Basically if your a Taco Bell fan or just want food it's on a great location. But if you are expecting to be blown away I'm sure your local one can do the exact same job.

sbpxyRbwBzxSQmSAJmMeHw.text: Alright, if you think, this is just a regular taco bell, let me tell you girl are you wrong! We literally dressed up fancy just to come here and take a photo! (see photo I uplaoded)  This is probably one of the fanciest Taco Bell I have ever experienced! (Which doesn't say much because I am not really a Taco Bell fan but still).  Before going in, already there is a giant vegas appropreiate giant logo on the outside lit up saying taco bell. They have DJ upstairs blasting music, multiple TV screens showing all different sports, and lots of fancy seating areas.   The store is a bit small compare to the population that comes around. They have security around, and they sell booze! We ubered here to try their Baja Blast, which I guess was super hyped up. It tasted like 7-11 slushee mixed with alcohol of your choice. They have rum, tequila, etc etc. I tried toe one with rum and the one with tequila. They both tasted alright, I'd give it a 3/5. I would still say fat tuesdays are way better.   This place is pretty clean compare to many of the places on the strip, esp fast food wise. They have soft couch seats, and fancy bar looking tables. Music playing all night long. Second floor is super loud, its where the speakers are and the DJ, so if you want more of a conversation, I highly recommend downstairs.   This taco bell is more of a place for experience I fell than anything else. It's  different atmosphere, and a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. we dressed to impress at Taco Bell!

3EyjmRBvALBH8aRWJ520MQ.text: Changing the Taco game.   The Taco Bell Cantina is your average Taco Bell with some added Vegas personality! While the menu items are the same, this spinoff is largely known for its alcoholic beverages and Vegas vibes.   The Cantina includes two floors and a patio - which is the perfect spot for people watching along the strip! You can purchase both food and beverage at the first floor bar, and they also offer multiple kiosks for customers to expedite the ordering process.   Upstairs is a ton of additional seating, as well as a DJ and dance floor to get the party started!   While I dig the added cocktails, I'd love to see the Cantina offer a few exclusive items outside of the traditional menu. I was also bummed that you can't order a water cup, even with a purchase.

PbDhvM1_k9QZ1L5WYuEuYg.text: After a trek under the blazing hot sun, the perfect way to cool down in Vegas is with a Baja Blast with Tequila. Hands down our favorite drink over the weekend.   TBC is the upgraded version of a regular Taco Bell. It has similar menu with upgraded touch screens to order. They even sold merch inside the store. The place could sit a couple of people inside and upstairs. They also host wedding events! While dining, one of the staff did turn the sign around for private event, so I assumed that people did get married there.   Overall, the food is the same as other Taco Bell. We loved our Baja blast. Unfortunately, this location does not offer water cups, but rather sells water bottles. We even paid for $2+ for a cup just to put ice (no they were not covered in gold). A one and done destination, but I'd probably send someone for a Baja blast!

eC1-FpP18ET_hp110hlTnw.text: Yes, this is THE taco bell. The one that I've seen in articles and blogs for years. I was finally in Vegas for the weekend, and couldn't help but sneak out of the club to grab a taco bell, and an adult beverage.  It's the same great taco bell taste, with the Vegas lights, Vegas booze, and Vegas fun. They have just about everything you could imagine, and more. This Taco Bell Cantina location also has a killer playlist bumping, yard long frozen adult beverages, and a wedding chapel and event space upstairs?!  You can't tell me that the ultimate wedding goals isn't getting eloped with an Elvis impersonator as the officiant, inside of a Taco Bell. And then celebrating with locos tacos and vodka spike baja blasts.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pins colada feeze

cQ_P2jIlomgF5TA7eIEKRw.text: This was a great place for a quick grab and go meal! It was my first time at this establishment and there is so much to see!   I ordered the cheesy bean and rice burrito and a regular sized margarita with tequila (they also have the choice of vodka so you can choose between those two options). Both the burrito and drink were amazing!   It was especially nice to be able to go upstairs and beat the heat while witnessing a Taco Bell wedding! Can you live mas? I later found out Taco Bell weddings are a real thing and they have 3 scheduled for that day!   I believe this is a great place to check out if in the area because it is nothing like your average Taco Bell back home. Come for the Baja blast with vodka, the Coca-Cola slush with captain Morgan, blue raspberry slush with vodka, or their other options! You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita w/ Hornitos Tequila

kpEnr5xFq_XSZvARdun4Vw.text: I know it's a corporate business but this was too unique and highly raved by my drunk friends that visit this place. Here was my experience on a early Friday night.  AMBIANCE: Parking: It's The Strip sooo parking structure or afar plaza parking...good luck.  Seating: Room for about 50 people, bar seating or group table seating.  Feels:  It's the Las Vegas Strip so there are a lot of things to do and see here. As for the lounge itself, it's like no other Taco Bell. A vibrant spot with room to chill, eat and dance. They have a live DJ playing all the popping beats old and new. There's also a few tvs if you want to catch up on sport scores.  FOOD: Chicken Quesadilla (Recommend) It was something cheap and easy to carry. Pretty cheesy and meat well scattered.  CUSTOMER SERVICE:  Pretty chill. No complaints here  TL; DR OVERALL: 4 Stars. It's an experience indeed with a reasonable price. If you're not close to a Fat Tuesdays, there slushies seem pretty nice and if you're hungry, this can be your drunken fix.  TIPS: * Great place for late night drinks * You can also order via their in-store machine. * No outside drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Quesadilla

4wMoY3oP4YjSbyFyUZbyMg.text: I visited Taco Bell Cantina while in Vegas in March and I LOVED IT! I am a huge fan of Taco Bell. Don't @ me. It's delicious. And I had wanted to visit this Taco Bell Cantina for some time, so I was really excited to finally get to check it out! And I was not disappointed.   The atmosphere it's awesome. It's a Taco Bell, but it's more like a club. Bright colors, a DJ, two levels. It's awesome!  And the drinks! Oh man, the drinks are amazing! I got a frozen Baja Blast with rum and it was delicious. And dangerous! You couldn't taste the alcohol at all, but it was definitely in there (and I paid for an extra shot).   If you're in Vegas and you like Taco Bell you have to check out Taco Bell Cantina! I'll definitely be returning on my next Vegas trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MSZiqiCgxrYzqcvnrR6iYA.text: YES. YES. YES.  Came here and can't believe I have never been here before. First off, taco bae is life anyway. But you're telling me I can wait for my food AND take a shot? Not to mention buy merch AND have a pretty killer view of the strip as well? WAIT. I CAN GET MARRIED HERE?! What is life!  They have couches and a lounge area upstairs that is extremely comfortable. Music is bumping and everyone is incredibly friendly. We had a great time only stopping in for a drink to check it out.

Hix6yqUrHbUKggUR1I04LA.text: It's been about a year and a half since I've been back to Vegas, but longer than that since my last trip to the Strip's Taco Bell Cantina. It is fast food heaaaven.  The inside of the Taco Bell Cantina is so cool! It's hard to explain unless you've actually been there/since it, so pls, just go for yourself!   The ability to add Bacardi/Skyy Vodka/Hornitos to a Baja Blast is just exactly what Vegas is intended for. We got a 32 ounce Baja Blast with vodka and we were in looove.  Correct me if I'm wrong, but back home in Washington they don't have the Spicy Potato Burrito on the menu. I saw that and HAD to try it. So glad I did, because it's probably one of my favorite new menu items. It's definitely got a kick to it and the potatoes are perfectly crispy, topped with some melty cheese and lettuce. F*** me upppp.  The prices here are comparable to any other Taco Bell for food, but the drinks will cost you a pretty penny - as if that's not the norm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fine. Dining.
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alcoholic Baja Blast!

Wz8UBedGx0hoOWAxWDuqqw.text: Definitely the hippest Taco Bell I've ever been to with very high industrial style ceiling and pop music blaring from a nightclub quality sound system.   Tends to get very busy but fastest way to get your food is via the automated kiosks.   Taco Bell has a plethora of special foods these days from Doritos tacos to French fry based "rattlesnake" burritos and nachos.  You can't always figure out what exactly will be in each item (we ordered nachos - one time it had jalapenos the next time no jalapenos but sour cream instead) but during an extended stay across the street at the Cosmopolitan we'd occasionally bring take out food from here up to the suite for lunch, and it all tasted good.   I rate it four stars among fast food joints for consistency and variety of menu.  At least what you get ends up looking more or less like the picture on the Taco Bell menu versus say McDonald's where the misshapen flattened burger you get doesn't resemble the menu pic whatsoever.

2Z4hoF68EY19Na3ybZeSyw.text: I've always seen this place online and it was a must to for my bachelorette party last Friday night. Very clean and fun. Load music is playing and all the employees were super nice.   They shouted me out on the speaker saying there was a bachelorette party in the house. Made me feel super special!   I've always loved taco bell food but mannnn the alcoholic drinks were beyond impressive. Overall amazing and fun experience. My girls were dancing the entire time. Food came out super fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean burritos and alcoholic Baja blast

GjfeWz86etHdD8X02mfLSg.text: Wow.  honestly, thats what i said out loud when i first walked in. Its 2-stories and there's a DJ upstairs. Whhaaaaat?! this place is so nice and modern. they sell merch, they sell freezes with alcohol - they have a few secret menu items. pretty neat.  I am obsessed w/the strawberry pina colada freeze. I tried it without alcohol and with alcohol and either way, its delicious. Service here is a little on/off but I mean, its not that serious. You order on the little screens and within minutes your food will arrive.  I didn't even go to Fat Tuesday this time around because I came here instead! I have no regrets either lol except that maybe I should've gotten one more before I left lol

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1BPUb9kLBK4QaG7xAlJy9w.text: It's really infuriating after spending 75 bucks at a glorified fast food joint that they won't give you a cup of water after asking twice.  I used to love this place but now this will be my last visit. I in in fact will be boycotting Taco Bell nationwide from now on!

LgupYcjt57nw7kMGJVbb3w.text: Taco Bell Cantina is an important place.  We need one of these in every major city.  You might think I'm joking but please just step inside and check this place out for yourself.    You'll probably be struck first by the deafening club music and the DJ on the second floor.  Or maybe the gigantic (adult) drink station.  I wasn't sure how I'd react, reading reviews before stepping into this place but pretty soon I was unknowingly swaying my hips and bumping club music while waiting to order my crunchwrap supreme. It's cool and it's fun and funny and ridiculous all at once.  The food is about the same price as regular Taco Bell - with regular Vegas markups.  Maybe add $1-$3 extra to your meal.  Sounds tacky and maybe I was caught up in the moment, but the food tastes like it's actually kind of been prepared with care?  There's certainly a ceiling on how good the food can actually taste as it's still fast 'mexican' food, but still, pleasantly surprised.  The drinks are Fat Tuesday prices but just, somehow, cooler.  I'd highly recommend the Pina Colada with two shots of tequila.   Instead of checking out all the other typical fast food joints nearby, be cool and try this place!  You're bound to say 'Wow' at least 17 times during your trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In case you fall in love while at Taco Bell cantina... get married!
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pick your poison
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pina Colada (w/ 2 shots of tequila) in TACO BELL?

MIgnWt-fyvEnIxRgiN-96g.text: This is the best Taco Bell ever!! I love that it is two stories, they had a DJ, and they served very good alcohol slushees! The prices were reasonable for the food and drinks! I will definitely be returning when i am in Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slushee with vodka

6DjTGw4B9Dv8oRyG4AJkBQ.text: I have been to cantina many times on my Vegas trips because I love Taco Bell. The vibe is always amazing and the music is better than the clubs on the strip LOL. However, the employees are never friendly. It's difficult to order because of the noise, which always seems to upset the employees. Tonight, they messed up my entire order with my family. I ordered the nacho fries box, which comes with a drink, nacho fries, a Doritos loco taco, and a 5 layer burrito. I ordered the burrito with no sour cream, which was on the receipt and they still put sour cream. I had to do my best to squeeze it out because by the tome I got to eat my burrito, I had already gone to them for two other mishaps. For one, they forgot to give me my taco and two, they put onion in my little sister's burrito even though we ordered that without onions. The guy I had to talk to at the counter where you pick up your order was so rude about it. Both times I approached as nicely as possible, because things happen, but he didn't even look at me or say anything. He just took my items and then gave me the correct thing. I'm glad he at least did that. Later on, I noticed that several people were going up to The counter after receiving wrong orders:

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0RKz6Owq3KUviT57v89rEg.text: Heaven! That is pretty much all I have to say! Def want to come back during the night to experience the clubbing aspect of it. I am a huge fan of Taco Bell so when I planned my Vegas trip, I knew I had to make a stop here.   The decor is so cool and the atmosphere is great too. They have these screens where you can order your food and did I mention they have a bar!!!! Yes, a bar!!!! You can order those cool collector plastic bottles where you can fill it with your favorite margarita. The beer is put into a cup with a magnet underneath that you can keep as a souvenir.   The menu is pretty much the same as back home so I hope they incorporate some secret menu items for this location if they don't already. We will def be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0gXhqsZFJmDCigD1KxlUMQ.text: I was honestly surprised at how good this Taco Bell was. This was the first thing we tried off the flight because we were tired and wanted something quick.   Our food took a minute but came out hot and everything actually tasted fresh compared to the usual Taco Bell.   They even serve alcohol and have self serve tablets so you can order quickly. It was a good experience.   Having music and large TVs upstairs made the experience better. The drinks are cheaper compared to some of the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The drink display/selection right behind the counter
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The side outside the restaurant!

8cgdnGMptndOrBgTDVpG5A.text: The best Taco Bell I've ever been to!  I have heard about this particular Taco Bell having alcoholic freezes and happened to be there for a few days at the Strip. Not to mention that it was 104-107 throughout the day I went here.   The inside is clean, and very cool. I ended up getting a Margarita flavored Freeze with Tequila and a Beefy Frito Burrito. The Freeze was extremely refreshing and the Burrito was full of flavor. Did I mention that they have 2 stories? Upstairs had AC and giant TVs and a view of the strip.   This place was so good that I ended up going AGIAN the same night and got a Blue Raspberry Freeze with Tequila.   I don't know if I can ever get a Freeze from a regular Taco Bell again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside the main entrance
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Upstair Counter

iPEisXuNbE5W_uxw6VSmUw.text: Taco Bell is usually my last stop on a night out on the town but in Vegas it's now a first! Walked into the cantina right as Get Low by Lil Jon started playing and immediately felt at home. Grabbed a yard of the Baja blast w/ vodka and headed up stairs to dance the night away with the DJ. Trust me, you don't want to miss out on the Taco Bell cantina experience!!!

gouBvqychXa9mPdaqw1KwQ.text: Taco Bell Cantina is The Real MVP!  Definitely not your average local Taco Bell.  Besides the food service, they had the frozen drinks which all spelled out "Taco Bell". Only a few were in service. They have a unique way of pouring draft drinks. Food is average. It seemed a bit disorganized but no major complaints. The music was great but a bit too loud. I didn't know they had a live DJ playing music up until we went upstairs. The upstairs section provides more seating and a view of the DJ. They also have TV's located upstairs which lets you see parts of the restaurant, including the DJ and some regular TV as well.  Come by and check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco Bell logo located upstairs.
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TV displays available.
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Upstairs seating w/ live DJ in the mix.

VEewhNGZEpcCCDR4QYnZtQ.text: It's a Taco Bell that serves alcoholic slushies. It's exactly the sort of place that comes to mind when you think, "I wonder what a Taco Bell would be like in Las Vegas"; neon lights, towers of bubbling liquids, and racks of schlocky merch.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty different from your average Taco Bell!

5szPYTZnkHbk1n0x9MrzbA.text: What a unique place this is! If I had to describe this place I'd say it was a Taco Bell with a little liquor and some good jams lol. Came here with my travel companions aka college friends after our day long trek through the Vegas streets and had a really fun time.  Basically this is a regular Taco Bell with a bar/lounge like feel offering typical menu items BUT alcohol additives to the drink options. You can choose from 4 different types of liquor to add to your drink of choice and it will be blended into a delicious slushie to your liking.  Also, this Taco Bell is open 24 hrs and has a DJ on the upper deck playing a variety of different hits and genres. This was a really unique Taco Bell and hey who doesn't like alcohol with their Mountain Dew Baja Blast and some good music too?!  Check it out y'all! It won't disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VLrmZZajWMvHg2i_OydCcg.text: Was in Vegas celebrating a 21st birthday and one of the hot spots they wanted to go to was the Taco Bell Cantina, yep that were we went haha.  Yep it has 2 stories, but most of the seating is out on the patio, not much room upstairs, but upstairs is where the DJ is mixin it! That was a great DJ just spinin the hits!  The food, just like normal taco bell food, only thing different, you can buy ya some booze with them tacos, and that's what they did!   I can see how this is catchy, its perfect for Vegas. If looking for something different, go check it out!

YsFn2LD1xdimm9EXc3gecw.text: My family and I always have to come here when we're in Las Vegas! We stay in a hotel nearby so we always walk over and get freezes and food. They have so many freezes to choose from and they're all delicious! You can get them in the regular sizes or the huge ones. I usually stick with the baja blast flavor and you can get the alcohol mixed in if you want! The food is always good as well. The chicken quesadilla and beef chalupa are my favorites, but I love everything pretty much. Definitely stop by if you're walking the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. huge size of baja blast freeze
Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. inside

fIsZD7wh6FfJ0bzUqBO9iA.text: I was EXTREMELY disappointed with my visit to Taco Bell Cantina. After a long night out, my friends and I decided to visit the Taco Bella Cantina.  After 4 of us ordered food at the kiosk, we went and sat down to wait. 2 of my friends received their food in about 5 minutes. Me and my other friend continued to wait. After about 40 minutes we began to get extremely frustrated. We walked up the counter to see what was going on. Once we were up there we realized that there were others having the same problem. We ask the women who was expediting the food where our order was and she very flustered and seemed lost. We explained to her the problem and what we ordered. Instead of just making our food and the others who had been waiting about an hour at this point she continued to just work on the other orders. She told us our orders were coming from the back. Another 15 minutes and still no food, she then tried to explain that there were a lot of orders coming in but that would not create a 45 minute discrepancy between me and my friends. Her lack of trying to fix the problem was disappointing and I was ready for a refund. I FINALLY got my food but I doubt I'll be visit Taco Bell again.

9NVyVmuIHsBzqjvaNX45PA.text: 24/7 Taco Bell is what I need in my life. Came here 1 AM in the morning and this place was still super packed. I order the new double stacked tacos and it is probably the first time in my life where the item looked darn close to the picture. Taste wise, I couldn't really tell because I just needed food in my stomach. They had a bunch of alcoholic slushies which I didn't get to try but will get next time.   The restaurant has a very nice layout with outdoor seating and an upstairs. I was too messed up to get upstairs. So I just enjoyed the downstairs part. I love the soda station because it looks like the machines that dispenses beer but with all wooden handles.   The only knock is that the music is WAY TOO LOUD. It's very hard to talk even in the open door area. Never had I had to yell at the cashier to tell her what I wanted. I was exhausted from tell her my specifics so I just said ONE OF EACH FROM THAT MENU. Aside from that, this place is awesome and wish there was more like it everywhere else.

Kg7pgryDfRe6XAcd9B5_bg.text: Freshest food I've ever gotten at any Taco Bell anywhere. Along with reasonable pricing especially being on the strip. Can't wait to go back!

x_YaasLavvK_ZaNvV6HWsg.text: You know exactly what you're getting yourself into coming to the Taco Bell Cantina. If you're reading these reviews to decide whether or not to come because you're on the fence, you probably won't be impressed. If you love Taco Bell and you're super excited to try it and you're just reading reviews to get you more hyped, then GAME. ON.  This Taco Bell Cantina is two stories, has a few special menu items that can't be found at other Taco Bell locations plus all the standard options, a little shop with Taco Bell swag, AND slushies that you can add alcohol to (which, let's be honest, who hasn't had Baja Blast and thought about how much better it would be with vodka in it?).  All your favorite Taco Bell food right on the Strip in Vegas with alcohol on the menu. Plus apparently you can get married here now? So yeah, get outta here with that "But Del Taco has fries" trash. Taco Bell wins.

1fAu_4cyFrHNMyOaTqr2JQ.text: This taco bell is so cute. It is the perfect place to go to after walking around the strip and drinking. I know, you're thinking why would I want to go to a Taco Bell? Well, this one was Vegas style. It had a DJ playing (the music here was good), it had good alcoholic drinks, and good food. I would recommend this place!

i-We_ljNSPCdMHfeUIarzQ.text: ITS SO LIT!!!!!!!!!!  look, I'm more of a del taco kind of gal but this place was amazing. i walked in and felt like i was in a club. though this place is smaller in person... but they blast loud hip-hop music (at least when i was there) where most of the shop is store merchandise for sale.  there is also a huge clear window where you can watch the wonderful taco makings of the staff for all your orders!  i didn't order the food... but i tried the blue raspberry with tequila and mountain dew blast with vodka and they were SOOO good... though i truly don't know if there was any alcohol in it because it didn't taste of any (aka delicious) and didn't get me drunk at all. but it was great because i enjoyed the taste and vibe of the location!  recommend you check it out! got me excited after being sluggish from a buffet just by walking in!

CnLdjeekI2Npl0894oHFjg.text: Im updating my review!! I came here a 2nd time. This taco bell is well improved. We got our food at lightening speed and the food was hot and delicious. I love that they have Volcano tacos here. One of my well favorites.

wcm4_vrfT1pR2upsLVtb3g.text: My girlfriend is the biggest Taco Bell fan in the entire world, let alone Las Vegas, so she HAD to go to this one.  She was in awe of everything.  She had a gigantic alcoholic slushy, which she loved, and of course, a taco.  It was typical tacos, but the atmosphere is awesome!! It was very nice inside with updated furniture and counters.  We didn't go upstairs because we were on the run, but it seems awesome, too.  Service was fast and my girlfriend had no problems with the food.  Viva la Taco Bell!

9dKC5pIocpWBF0hxUp0ebg.text: Pretty disappointed, it's just a Taco Bell where they can add some vodka to their sickenly sweet drinks, and pay double for the food. If you're a Taco Bell fan I would recommend going at least once so you can say you've been, and get the experience, because it is a really neat layout, but I won't ever go back.

fkJ2UdVKK5lwGx7TbLEZVg.text: Taco Bell and Booze. What more do you want?  We wanted to be pretty low-key our first night in Vegas, so we decided on Taco Bell and alcohol for dinner.   It's pretty much your standard Taco Bell, just with merchandise and alcohol.   There's a variety of drinks you can choose from and then you choose your alcohol: Vodka, Tequila, Rum or something else I can't remember :)  I decided on a Cherry Icee with 2 shots of vodka. It was glorious. Along side my crunch-wrap, it was pretty much the best taco bell dinner I've ever had.

04WJazJmY9ooh-W_-BR2XQ.text: It's exactly what you would expect from a Taco Bell on the Las Vegas Strip.  Full of lights, pounding music and slushy alcohol - this is what you would expect from a Vegas experience. The decor is also fun - followed the sign "Let's Take this Party Upstairs"; went up the stairs to the second level where it was dark and found a group of younger kids hanging out - kind of like a poor man nightclub at that point.  There's also a patio with heaters if you want it slightly quieter.  The menu is the same as any other Taco Bell, the service is the same.

DQsdqBesNiMQ3xtM6ivq1Q.text: Normally I wouldn't rate chain restaurants but after coming here and becoming severely disappointed, I just had to let the world know. For whatever reason, this Taco Bell doesn't live up to par as the ones back near my home. The proportions are a lot smaller and the soft drink bar makes you feel like you're in the old Wild West. Service wasn't great either because the lady behind the cash register made it seem like she hated her job. When we asked what alcohol shots go with the Baja blast, the lady couldn't tell us because she "didn't know." She also didn't know how to have the right alcohol to Baja Blast ratio because when we got our $10 regular sized drink, it ended up tasting like straight tequila with no sort of Baja Blast remnants. We'll most likely stick to Fat Tuesdays if we want a alcoholic slushie drink.

ua9qgtqh8qkSlmupy0tD9g.text: I get it---it's frigging Taco Bell, so why bother to pay for parking and come to this over-exaggerated mexican stand rather than going somewhere else?   BECAUSE IT'S AWESOME.   I took my cousin here on a Friday night. He hadn't been to vegas in about 2 years and wanted to come check this place out. He was 16 at the time and he felt like an absolute "cool boy", by staying out late on the strip and walking into the Cantina while the music was blasting. Food is regular, but that's not really what you pay for when you come here. It's the atmosphere. PLUS, alcoholic taco bell slushies, man!  I think we stayed for a good 1.5 hours, and half of that was just finishing our slushies and listening to the DJ play. My cousin loved it and so did I.

1NOWG3Wz_w1IVjag0TiPhg.text: Let's first preface, that there is no Del Taco on the strip. There is a Taco Bell (Cantina!) though, and growing up in Northern California, I have an affinity to Taco Bell vs. Del Taco.  However, living in Southern California for the last 14 years, Del Taco has started to creep up and take over... mostly as drunk food, and mostly the Quesadilla... so that is why I YELP'd Del Taco, and found Taco Bell Cantina Instead.  Generally speaking, 24 hour Taco Bell.  Prices similar to off strip, and they serve Frozen Alcoholic beverages.  DJ Spins music upstairs, and the place is packed. Those workers are mad efficient too, they just be cranking out orders non-stop!  What more do you need to know?  Damn that music is loud too... people should just party here.  Beware the cameras upstairs, that display you on the big screen that everyone in the restaurant can see. So don't pass out, and don't do anything you don't want other people to see. LMAO.

lNDsdwFomgZed-ROG5R6zA.text: What a ridiculous service! I know it's 3am but if you are gonna work there no matter what, have a smile in your face and a good attitude. To start with the cashier (no name tag) that took my order rolled her at me when I was placing my order. Though that was very rude! Then the cooks yawning as they prepping my food and then smiling at me because I saw her yawning! Took about 30 minutes to get my food and it was only 4 items. Only 3 people in from of me. Works service ever.

bo_F-KEofS8Opq-ji6tGsg.text: They don't have cinnamon twists, but you can get alcohol and beer that fills from the bottom so that's a plus. U ique take on taco Bell for sure.

itNZeeh2CLPe8B2XusibqA.text: I stopped here with a large group and the taco shells tasted very bad. I don't like saying that it was gross because I usually enjoy eating at Taco Bell. However, this particular restaurant was simply awful.  My party ordered several items from the menu and everyone noticed the taste as less than satisfactory. When we told the workers that the food tasted strange, they told us that other customers returned a 10 or 12 value back of tacos today!  I feel that they should have looked into this situation before selling more tacos or tostadas. The issue is basically the taco shells. Even the taco shell on my friend's tostada did not taste good. I hope we do not get sick from eating here!  Overall we were disappointed. The restroom was disgusting as well.

elZfWfycS2xCxXoOIsIsDA.text: i Never write a review when it comes to fast food restaurants, but since i love taco bell i just had to stop and see this place,  to begin with if you don't like taco bell, than this review isn't going to change your mind.  they have more items than your regular taco bell restaurant, and they serve alcoholic drinks. the staff can use a little more  smiles but than again its taco bell i only come here for the food.

1cDqCFVTrpwN4nLxRogVFA.text: Taco Bell on the strip is a huge plus. Other than that your franchises across the city does a better job of basic operations . No clear distinct line to order food. Restroom for only one person male /female . Honestly Not worth the hype . Won't be able to handle the amount of business and stress of a typical summer day in vegas .

xK5KWO7ETZIU9aQnAzZ5DQ.text: What is wrong with this place? The music is so loud that you can not even order without yelling.  The cashiers get the order wrong. I can understand the need to appeal to young people but when you can't even hear your order is ready and you are hungry - makes sense to go somewhere else.

_wfLigqEZ6-cp13RZvNpOA.text: Definitely not all that they crack it up to be. It is a fairly small place. We ordered the slushee drinks and they definitely skimped on the booze especially for the price. Big tvs but when we were there we didn't see any dj. The soda was made to look like a beer tap Machine which looks really cool but it also takes a good minute to fill your cups!!! It was cool to say I did it but can't say I'll ever feel the need to do it again!!!

0Yyt9JlSmNdzDwRnp0acfg.text: This Vegas hot spot is pretty neat and a must see. The food was fresher than I have ever experienced at any other Taco Bell. It's pretty much the same menu as other restaurants with the exception of alcohol. The music is entirely too loud and I left with a headache. The staff was friend, the food was quick and good, and the seating would be difficult during peak hours.

4RclQ9JjHyt_JudQ5qFqYA.text: Took 30 minutes to get food from a fast food place. Not worth it.. tastes the same and overcrowded.

q1GgP8LGERoRdDLFFGESeQ.text: The food, it's typical Taco Bell. I didn't get an alcohol drink, though my sister did and it was strong. But also 10 bucks. Though it was really loud and smaller then i expected. it fit the bill at 3am.

fWcrPjeOV9Y_EogMKfXL2A.text: Went here on a Saturday night before going out for a quick bite to eat, and to obviously say I was at THE Taco Bell cantina. It's nice on the outside-has outdoor seating for the warmer temps or for those who just want to be outside. When you walk in, you are immediately immersed in THE loudest music you will ever hear. Being in a club was quieter than that music. I had to yell at the cashier so they could hear my order. There were some merchandise racks that you could buy Taco Bell shirts, etc. A cool option at this place is alcoholic freezes, which are moderately expensive but not bad for Vegas price. The food itself is relatively cheap-I got two quesadillas and a medium drink for $11...and it was super good. There's an upstairs area with different seating arrangements and a live DJ. Overall it was definitely worth going to, but the only complaint is that the music was too loud!

rmRhXlmQR6IWEFUgLYcG_Q.text: I was so excited to go here. The menu is different and so I had to try some new items. The jalapeno dippers were so flipping hot neither of us could choke them down. The alcohol part was cool. Service was ok and pretty unorganized.  Mountain Dew was out and we told them and was never refilled. Then as we're trying to eat all of a sudden the music went from ghetto tolerable to insane loud I don't know what the hell it was.  We couldn't even talk and we were right next to each other.  We left without finishing our food and got a different drink.  never again.

3Uwysq-PUFqGPyOZwMAusg.text: Nothing special about this Taco Bell. The inside is extremely small, to the point where they don't have enough room for people waiting in line and those waiting for food. Speaking of waiting for food, it took nearly 30 minutes to get mine, and the system they use to alert people when their food is ready doesn't work properly. The food is the same price as a normal Taco Bell. The only special menu item they have is their alcoholic freezes, which will cost you $10 for a drink with 1 shot. Hardly any seating in this place. Definitely not worth going back.

XgzD-Sqim87YPVVDivM7Dg.text: Went to this spot after the ball dropped on NYE. There was a good DJ, drinks and food and no cover charge!! People walking by seemed really confused about what they were looking at because at first glance it looks like a club or a bar especially with the music blasting.

QeSWOdQFazvUwAjJyItGTw.text: I was tired and my feet hurt last night, but when I walked into Taco Bell Cantina the vibe was amazing and gave me energy. As always the food at Taco Bell was awesome. The drinks were AMAZIIIIING! The Lemonade Baja Blast with Tequila was delicious. It was a great combination. If you don't like Taco Bell, I urge you to try Taco Bell Cantina, if not for the food then for DJ Tony Sinatra. He was there when I went on Saturday night. Overall, it was a great first experience.

YCrhACjFIuBdltBQK3OHaA.text: Im not a big fan of taco bell but my kids are.   So we stopped by here for them to eat.   They have a nice place to sit and relax.  And they also have adult slushies. 4yLn6t5-GDYPNPnr13it-Q.text: This place has changed the way I look at Taco Bells! They have lots of food options (more than my hometown Taco Bell) as well as an extensive variety of slushy and drink options (with or without alcohol). The staff was very friendly and the food was delicious as usual, but this location is definitely worth a stop. One of a kind experience!

cDNwy0ATHPeeJndrFkguYg.text: This place is literally just another Taco Bell with alcoholic beverages. The coolest thing is the soda fountain...not your typical soda fountain but has handles so I feel like I'm pouring a beer out of a keg or something. But other than that, not very noteworthy other than it's in the middle of the strip.

QVq6A027YCb31WBG_GrWBA.text: YOOO this Taco Bell is poppin! there was a Dj when I went and the energy from the employees and security guard was dope. EVERYONE was dancing. I came back the next day around 4am and they were still playing music. Love the energy!

tNoztr3jhGQw_BGddHy98g.text: There is absolutely, positively no reason to ever go to this place. I understand that they're trying to "rock the atmosphere" on the Vegas Strip but the music at 8 o'clock in the morning was so loud in the place that you could not understand what the lady was saying when she was trying to take my order. I have no idea if the food was any good because I had to leave i could not order or understand what she was saying. When I complain to the manager he basically Shrugged his shoulders and said sorry. It is definitely a stay away from place.

yFwtOuP0-G8L3j2tcQr8sA.text: This place is straight up GHETTO.  I love loud music but this was obnoxious.  Their sound system was absolutely horrendous.  The place was full of the trashiest people you'd ever see....just plain noped the eff outta there.

wWD6Er8julPxIop9vnBHDA.text: 24/7 Taco Bell with alcohol? Is this real life??? When in Vegas, you just have to come here because where else in the country can you get Taco Bell and alcohol at the same time ! I was super keen on coming here after seeing so many videos of it on Facebook and honestly I thought it was worth it.  Obviously the food is literally exactly the same that you would get in a normal taco bell and there's nothing special about it. But why change the food? That's exactly the food I go to taco bell for. If you change the food, it's no longer taco bell.   Inside there are these really cool lights and bubbly lit tubes going down on the menu over the cash registers. It's full of cool lights and there's a bunch of seating both inside and outside. It's basically a flashier version of Taco Bell that you would expect to see in Vegas. If you're a True taco bell fan, you can even buy souvenirs inside. The biggest con is the amount of people here and the line felt incredibly slow moving.   As far as the alcohol, you can pick from beer, wine, or the freezes which is basically the taco bell slushies with alcohol mixed in them. I would totally recommend the freezes since beer and wine you can get anywhere else. The baja blast freeze with bacardi was worth every ounce of sugar.   All in all, it's taco bell with alcohol so don't expect anything more then that. Not really sure why there are so many negative reviews of people having higher expectations. But to me, that combination alone totally makes it worth a visit and it's something you just have to experience when in Vegas even if it's just for the snapchat. The fact that it's open 24/7 makes it the prime spot to go to after a long night of clubbing and I highly recommend.

ZTki86cSrvDpnUCGr2oEng.text: Horrible service, credit card machines wont work, wont accept $100 bill, id'd my wife and I multiple times, and they were extremely rude and gave me attitude when I said we had already been id'd twice.  Definatly will never return

o_A7J4oww0f0d9DFCGe3HQ.text: Wouldn't imagine giving a 'fast food' joint 5 stars, ever! BUT it is literally 5 stars because I love their freakin' alcoholic Baja blast + they're open 24 hours + they have great service! The Baja blast was seriously 1000xs better than a Fat Tuesday. Also, they're not shady with their alcohol content! They'll make it as strong as you like and if you're crazy enough, you can even choose all the liquor you want! I was able to try their new naked chicken taco and it was just alright. The soda fountain is cool because it's similar to beer on draft. I wish we had a Taco Bell Cantina back home! I love it!!!!!!!

k80QrAI7828Pu5crCRzeGQ.text: Now, first things first, you need to your base score for regular Taco Bell and multiply that by 2. If you think Taco Bell is garbage, 2 x 0 = 0 (proof left as exercise to reader).  But I am a guy who occasionally likes to "Live Mas." Put it simply, it's Taco Bell, but with margaritas and loud music. Now, when I went the DJ was pretty good. Better than say contemporary DJs like Calvin Harris. But that's because Calvin Harris quite simply isn't that good. I digress, but people started dancing in the Taco Bell lobby. That's impressive. Also everyone got a shout-out.  Don't go on a date unless your date is legally deaf, or if your date is Calvin Harris. I had a doubledilla and it eh pretty ok I guess.  6.5/10 would recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend Ani enjoying his experience

X8JMANqsYZC_VU0SHGTVtg.text: Pretty sweet taco bell - I mean, if you want good tacos, hit up Tacos El Gordo. If you want that "I gotta eat now and nothing will do but Taco Bell" taco, then hit up this location for front row view of tacos being made, a variety of slushes, and fast service.  Also, open 24 hours, so no excuses, just go!

_6LNoZfUd5nydSsSfcwDUw.text: Okay so being a local and after seeing all the hype I had to try this place out. I honestly never thought I'd give a review for a Taco Bell since you pretty much know what you're getting when you go to Taco Bell. Taco Bell is pretty straight forward but like I said with all the hype I had to try this place out.   So the selling point of this place for me isn't even how futuristic and cool it looks. It's actually the price which for a college student like me is a great thing, I ate a nice meal, drink, and got a freeze for 10 bucks.   The food was also surprisingly delicious and well made. It did not taste like fast food at all and was really good for such a decent price. The only time this restaurant does get expensive is with the "twisted" freezes which is basically just a shot of alcohol into whatever flavor of freeze you want. The prices for the Twisted Freezes are very touristy and truth be told for what you get it's not worth it to me. The alcohol choices for your "twisted" freeze is kind of limited. It's basically vodka, rum, or tequila and it's really generic stuff like Bacardi.    They do have a ton of freeze flavors which I really like including some old classics like Baja Blast along with the new ones and the freezes are pretty cheap around 4 bucks (without alcohol). The biggest letdown to the Cantina though is actually the size, now it's not enough to warrant a star deduction but the place is small. It doesn't have downstairs indoor seating at all, the downstairs seating is actually on a patio outside which is heated and cooled though. The upstairs seating is really nice with plush chairs and booths along with massive flat screen tvs but the seating upstairs is limited. If the place is packed good luck getting a seat especially if you have a group with you.   All in all I really love the Taco Bell Cantina and will definitely be back especially if i'm on the strip. It's a nice and cheap place for locals and tourists to eat without breaking the bank and it's got a great atmosphere. The bubbling freeze tanks make me feel i'm in a cantina in a galaxy far far away which I really like and the plush seating upstairs is sick. I really love it and the food is really tasty, Taco Bell stepped up their game with their flagship restaurant.

30_ww33T5kWQFYlaa0HGTA.text: It's Taco Bell Cantina on the strip. Alcohol is served with your fast food, unlike the typical Taco Bell locations. I ordered a bubbly libation with one crunchy taco on a busy Friday night. The cashier handed me my beer after ordering so I only had to wait a few minutes for the taco. My order came out quickly, but hey it was only one taco. Nothing exceptional. Clean and easily accessible location. I didn't notice the prices to be higher except for the fact that alcohol can make your bill high...

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The entrance sign. Can&#39;t miss it

7m_lIq6XaIIO5Zdbjhe8mQ.text: As a Taco Bell enthusiast, this has to be the best created since the Volcano burrito. The atmosphere is great for a quick stop on the Vegas strip. It's also really beneficial to those who are tired of spending all of their money on meals. For $14 dollars I was able to get a cravings deal and a baja blast with a shot of bacardi in it. I was also really excited to see that there is an upper level which has a live DJ. Aside from my allegiance and bias towards Taco Bell, I definitely think that this is more of a "must" than In-N-Out burger if you're visiting Vegas.

QVE97bwd__Ll-Qz0qJKm5Q.text: Loved it! Great idea, good location for a cool spot to grab a Taco & slushees with lots of options for mixers! Club vibe Taco Bell, music is loud and fun, service was awesome, really nice servers! Wish all Taco Bell's were like this!

NquRvCmDtUy_iWshTplRUw.text: Drink was very pricey comparing to Fat Tuesday. All other food items were the same comparing to a regular Taco Bell. Nevertheless, the store design was cool.  #4

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Bell Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CTtx0R3MarK0xRcyiqCkow.text: If you give this place less than four stars, well, I don't want to know you. YOU'RE DEAD TO ME!   Yes, this is a Taco Bell. If you don't like Taco Bell in the first place, you're not going to like this one either. If you're a Taco Bell fan like me and aren't one to piss on a good time, then this place is fast food heaven. All the processed TB classics with an atmosphere that screams "VEGAS!"   There's a DJ, there are cameras all around the restaurant capturing drunk antics and good times from the incoming customers and diners, there is alcohol, and the food is somehow better than other Taco Bell restaurants even though it's the same ol' slop - I love it.   What did you expect, people? Filet mignon tacos topped with caviar and one hundred dollar bills? Nah, brah. You stay away, more tacos for me.

kUh_dzNSgyfXMx1POkn8yg.text: Very cool place. They sell alcohol and merchandise if your interested in that. Has a great layout. If you order online or the app you get an extra 15% of your total. It's worth it because either way you order on the kiosk they have. Food was made quickly and they don't skimp you.

TkPbZMJ5iLU0Is6MtXxB2Q.text: Who could pass up a chance at eating at a tavo bell that serves alcohol and offers weddings! The prices are great! They are just a few cents more than what I normally pay which is great when your spending elsewhere. And did I mention the ALCOHOL! We got a pina colada with rum! This was actually the best pinacolada I have ever had too! There are other flavors of slushies and alcohols you can choose from as well! Wanting to get hitched? Well theres and upstairs to this Cantina where the mood is set and after you tie the knot you can stuff your face with tacos. I mean sounds like a dream wedding right?!

ui_Xf_qCCNOtd3cA6Nb0Dw.text: The worst service. Doesn't do well under pressure. Gives the wrong order and doesn't match the receipt. Received the wrong order, even showed the receipt, they agreed and they said they were unable to correct it because their register was "closed"...  would not return. They suck.

NOCDHoQuNEbB3zXSioWMwg.text: How can you not walk into a place called "Taco Bell Cantina?"  My husband and I stopped in this place just to check it out and say we've been.  There is easy access off the strip if you're walking around.  The place is a little small, but there is some seating, with a patio and misters that allow you to watch the sights and sounds of the strip.    I can tell you that the most exciting thing for me was the "slushy."  I actually don't know what they are called here, but they have a Slurpee-like frozen concoction in a variety of flavors that they will add alcohol to.  I wanted the Pepsi one with Captain Morgan.  It was awesome!  Great treat on a hot Vegas night.    My husband picked up some Taco Bell eats, including a taco with a Doritos shell.  It was interesting.  We are not Taco Bell aficionados and so the food was just OK.  But the fun factor, slushee factor, and sightseeing from their patio makes this a four-star location.  Do yourself a favor and stop by so you can say you did.

11WzFt9Wf7_qgSXl1N4gUw.text: I had a drink from another place but was ordering food to go. Manager asked me to leave the Taco Bell even though I was waiting for my food to come out. Super rude. Continued to tell me I need to grab my food and leave immediately. Then told the security guard to stand next to me to make sure I left. Then went to the people making the food to tell them to rush. I did and said nothing to be treated this way. Never coming back. Super rude

DwUXmVhhSKaTj_QDJZalpQ.text: DO NOT COME HERE! Myself and a friend had food poisoning about an hour after eating here. It was most likely from the meat because our other friend was fine and the only thing she didn't eat was the meat.   We were extremely ill and this caused us to miss out on our seminar for work. Why is that fact important? Because we paid hundreds of dollars to attend this seminar and whoever contacted me when I just wanted to share my experience so that they were aware and could take better measures to make sure this doesn't happen to anyone else, wanted to insult me by offering me a refund of $12! NOT WHAT I WANTED AT ALL. A simple apology and being told they would follow up with the location and make sure food is being prepped and cooked properly is all that was needed. My friend also sent in her experience but no one contacted her. Clearly they also need to work on their customer service.   Side note: We were not drunk nor were we drinking so that's not why we were sick.

CQlnhfLsx6dPJksDRldyag.text: This place is lit, loud music, neon lights, and vodka icy drinks.   The seating is small, and there is extra seating upstairs, but i think most people go their orders to go.  You can try the alcoholic drinks before buying as well!
